item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "If you can't say anything nice about anyone else, come sit next to me." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Louise Brooks
item.description: "If I ever bore you, it'll be with a knife." -- Louise Brooks

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "You have absorb'd me. I have a sensation at the present moment as though I was dissolving." -- John Keats

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "On ne voit bien qu'avec le cœur. L'essentiel est invisible pour les yeux." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Betty Friedan
item.description: "No woman gets an orgasm from shining the kitchen floor. " -- Betty Friedan

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Anatole France
item.description: "To know is nothing at all; to imagine is everything." -- Anatole France

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Frank Stanford
item.description:
"-I have dreamed of escape, a forever
-to burn your suicide notes she read in Braille
-and the stars of dawn's trousseau" -- Frank Stanford

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I can stop one heart from breaking, I shall not live in vain." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "To know that you do not know is the best. To think you know when you do not is a disease. Recognizing this disease as a disease is to be free of it." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description:
"All my life, my heart has sought a thing I cannot name.
Remembered line from a long- forgotten poem" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "All colors made me happy: even gray. My eyes were such that literally they Took photographs. " -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Music melts all the separate parts of our bodies together." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Perhaps I write for no one. Perhaps for the same person children are writing for when they scrawl their names in the snow." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Emma Donoghue
item.description: "...sentences swallowed and sung back and swallowed all over again. She was made entirely out of words." -- Emma Donoghue

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Théophile Gautier
item.description: "To love is to admire with the heart; to admire is to love with the mind." -- Théophile Gautier

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "There ain't no devil, only God when he's drunk." -- Tom Waits

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I can levitate birds. No one cares." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Everything is blooming most recklessly; if it were voices instead of colors, there would be an unbelievable shrieking into the heart of the night." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Yet, no matter how deeply I go down into myself, my God is dark, and like a webbing made of a hundred roots that drink in silence." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "When I go around and speak on campuses, I still don't get young men standing up and saying, How can I combine career and family?" -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Muna Lee
Stephanie add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Edgar Degas
item.description: "Art is not what you see, but what you make others see." -- Edgar Degas

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "What was any art but a mold to imprison for a moment the shining elusive element which is life itself- life hurrying past us and running away, to strong to stop, too sweet to lose." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "Parting is all we know of heaven And all we need of hell" -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Mervyn Peake
item.description:
"If seeing her an hour before her last Weak cough into all blackness I could yet Be held by chalk-white walls
- <i>The Consumptive. Belsen 1945</i>" -- Mervyn Peake
